sentences.sContent: But my fancy accordion might as well have been a cardboard box that afternoon.
sentences.sContent_eng: But my fancy accordion might as well have been a cardboard box that afternoon.
sentences.sCn: 但是那天下午，我别致的手风琴好像变成了纸板盒。

sentences.sContent: All at once I pictured my own father, patiently enduring my nightly accordion practice sessions though he must have yearned for peace and quiet after his long days at the pizza factory.
sentences.sContent_eng: All at once I pictured my own father, patiently enduring my nightly accordion practice sessions though he must have yearned for peace and quiet after his long days at the pizza factory.
sentences.sCn: 突然，我想起了我的父亲。 虽然他在比萨厂呆了一整天后一定非常渴望清静，但还是耐心地忍受着我每天晚上练习手风琴的那段时间。

sentences.sContent: So you may be saying to yourself, I have to sign up right now for Swahili and calculus and accordion lessons before my brain withers away!
sentences.sContent_eng: So you may be saying to yourself, I have to sign up right now for Swahili and calculus and accordion lessons before my brain withers away!
sentences.sCn: 你或许因此对自己说，趁着我的大脑还没退化，赶紧报名学习史瓦西里文和微积分，还有手风琴班吧！

trans.tranOther: a musical instrument like a large box that you hold in both hands. You play it by pressing the sides together and pulling them out again, while you push buttons and  key s  .
